availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Jane Harden Rutledge in Jefferson County, Kentucky on October 13, 1845. Father of John Rutledge, Laura Rutledge, Albert Rutledge. Wool carder in Louisville, Kentucky in 1850. Tavern keeper in Louisville, Kentucky in 1860. Postmaster in Jefferson County, Kentucky from 1860 to 1864. Constable in Louisville, Kentucky in 1865 and 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville District 3, p. 288B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson, Louisville District 1, p. 751.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482707, p. 184.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, p. 102, counties Grayson-Knott, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), p. 362, 507
